meanings.definition: Administering a drug to someone in order to induce sleep or alter their mental state.
meanings.sent1: The nurse was drugging the patient with a sedative to help them sleep.
meanings.sent2: He was caught drugging his friend's drink at the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he was drugging the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The music was so soothing, it felt like it was drugging my senses.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the flowers was drugging me into a state of relaxation.

meanings.definition: Adding a drug to food or drink without the person's knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky chef was drugging the soup with a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent2: She suspected someone was drugging her coffee every morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to be drugging the dog's water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious potion was drugging the villagers into a deep slumber.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cookies was drugging me into taking another bite.

meanings.definition: The act of using drugs recreationally.
meanings.sent1: His drugging at the party led to some unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends engaged in drugging during their weekend getaway.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a humorous take on recreational drugging.
meanings.sent4: The city nightlife was a whirlwind of drugging and dancing.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted the dangers of excessive drugging in a realistic way.
